intro: Centaurium erythraea subsp. rhodense, commonly known as red-centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically red or reddish-purple, with five petals and prominent yellow veins. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
